snippet.title: Alanis Morissette to perform in Australia for the first time in nearly 20 years
snippet.content:
Exciting news for angsty '90s teens who chewed up their Jagged Little Pill tapes with obsessive listens. Alanis Morissette is set to perform in Australia for the first time in almost 20 years, with two shows in Sydney and Melbourne next January.
Up Next
Prince dies at 57
00:47
More Music Videos
Previous slide Next slide
00:47 Prince dies at 57
Prince dies at 57
Music icon Prince, has been found dead at his Paisley Park complex in Minnesota.
Up Next
Stone Temple Pilots frontman Scott Weiland dead at 48
00:48
Alanis Morissette embraces the 'angry' tag decades after hit album
As her hit album Jagged Little Pill turns 20, the Canadian singer says being labelled angry is "so lovely."
The gigs will be held at Melbourne's Palais Theatre on Tuesday January 23 and Sydney's ICC Theatre on Wednesday January 24. Billed as "acoustic and intimate", the shows will mark the singer's first performances in Australia since 1999, when she toured her fourth album Supposed Former Infatuation Junkie.Photo: Rick Wood The gigs will see the Grammy-winning star performing songs "spanning her entire career in an intimate acoustic trio setting," a press release said. Morissette, 43, hasn't released an album since 2012's coolly received Havoc and Bright Lights, instead focusing on her monthly podcast Conversation with Alanis Morissette and a regular advice column for The Guardian. She has also been involved in charitable work with the UN, and gave birth to her second child Onyx last July.
However, she returned with a few high-profile appearances in the past couple of years - including a viral cameo on James Corden's late night show, where she updated the lyrics to her oft-discussed anthem Ironic - as fans celebrated the 20th anniversary re-release of her seminal 1995 album Jagged Little Pill.
You will now receive updates from
Entertainment Newsletter
Entertainment Newsletter
Get the latest news and updates emailed straight to your inbox.
She is also working on a Broadway musical adaptation of the album with Oscar-winning Juno screenwriter Diablo Cody, set to debut in May next year.Photo: Chugg Entertainment "Thankfully, the stories that were being told I can stand by, so I'm not cringing when I repeat them," Morissette told Elle last year about still performing the brutally bare songs that made her an icon. "There was a timelessness to what I was expressing... When I wrote [Jagged Little Pill] I was in a bit of a vacuum, and then when people connected with it, I realised that I was being given this opportunity to support and uplift and empathise with people." Tickets to the gigs go on sale on Monday August 7 at 9am AEST.
